2094.subject: SBS
2094.descrlong: Covers U.S. societies, government, and territorial and economic expansion from pre-contact Native America to 1920. Starts students on a teaching pathway addressing how they might teach this content, and prepares students for a major concentration in history. Emphasizes research and analysis of primary sources consistent with California State standards for teaching fifth and eighth grade U.S. history. Central issues in this course are class, ethnicity, gender, and multiculturalism.  (Offered spring semester.)
